result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A. Stanley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment/30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for.

DNA Sample if not done.
Continue AODA treatment.
Maintain Absolute Sobriety. 
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.
Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.

supervisions.notes:
Huber Privileges.
Credit for 106 days if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Comply with conditions as set forth in Ct. 1.

DNA Order, Acknowledgment & Proof of Submission

3:23 PM/Rm. 301/Defendant Robert A. Stanley appeared by video, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Parties and Court Reporter by Zoom.  Plea agreement.  On plea to both counts (information mirroring complaint sent to Def.) of information, joint recommendation:  Ct. 1 - sentence withheld, 3 years probation concurrent to current supervision, DNA sample if not done and surcharge, follow through with AODA treatment recommendations, no use of alcohol, no illegal possession of controlled substances, no presence in establishments with a Class B liquor license, employment, counseling as deemed necessary by agent.  Ct. 2 - 1 year jail imposed & stayed, 1 year probation concurrent with any other supervision, costs, DNA, 1 day jail, same conditions as Ct. 1.  Court advises Def. of right to preliminary hearing and reviews with Def.  Def. is still waiving counsel.  Def. waives preliminary hearing, Court accepts, finds probable cause and binds case over.  Def. has copy of information and waives its reading.  Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights form filed and Court reviews with Def.  Ct. 1 - guilty plea.  Ct. 2 - guilty plea.  Court advises Def. of constitutional rights and right to jury trial.  Def. waives rights and jury trial.  Court advises Def. of elements and penalties.  Def. advised of possible deportation if not US citizen.  Court finds pleas entered freely and voluntarily.  Factual basis.  Court accepts plea and finds Def. guilty of Cts. 1 and 2.  Sentencing remarks by State.  Def. has nothing to say.  Court orders Ct. 1 - sentence withheld, 3 years probation, costs, DNA sample if not done and surcharge, continue AODA treatment, maintain absolute sobriety, no illegal use or possession of controlled substances, no presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, maintain full time employment/30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for, counseling as deemed necessary by agent.  Ct. 2 - 1 year jail imposed and stayed, huber, 1 year probation, costs, DNA surcharge, 1 day jail (meaning today), same conditions as Ct. 1.  Def. advised of voting and firearm rights.  Def. advised of postconviction rights.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Credit 106 days if revoked. One day conditional jail commencing today.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

09:49 AM/Rm. 301/Defendant Robert A. Stanley in court, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert A. Stanley appeared by video means.  Parties and reporter by Zoom.  This hearing is regarding Def. wanting to represent himself.  Def. has not completed waiver form but would like to proceed today with waiver of attorney.  Court begins review of waiver of attorney with Def. but finds a waiver form was filed previously.  Court reviews form with Def.  Court advises Def. of charges and penalties.  Def. is asking Court to allow him to represent himself.  Court finds Def. is voluntarily waiving right to attorney.  Court finds Def. is competent to represent himself and allows him to exercise that right.  Court advises Def. of right to preliminary hearing and time limits.  Def. waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on June 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Routed to CC's JA

03:20 PM Defendant Robert A. Stanley in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert A. Stanley appeared by video means, via zoom.  Court review history of case. Def. is on a probation hold.  Def. is also waiting for treatment. Def. wants to maybe represent himself.  State advise def. already had hearing to represent himself and than change his mind.  Court will set for hearing for waiver of attorney.  Def. makes statement and want to represent himself. Def. questions about waiving atty rights.  Def. wants to know when bed date for treatment is. Court adjourns.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 09:45 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

Defendant is representing himself. Waiver of right to an attorney is filed. Attorney Gebert makes statement regarding treatment ATR, future possible modified signature bond and future hearings. Defendant responds. Court makes statement. Defendant chooses to wait for an attorney. Adjourned Inital Appearance is scheduled 5-23-22 at 1:30PM. Court is adjourned.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:27 PM Defendant Robert A. Stanley in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert A. Stanley appeared by video means. All parties via zoom.   Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. makes statement. Def. will call P.D. State gives bail/bond recommendation. Def. is on a probation hold. Court explains def. in on a hold and Court will reserve right to be heard on bond @ Later date. Court orders $2,000 cash bond with condition.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
